verses.roman:
āgaccha yāma gehān naḥ
sa-nāthān kurv adhokṣaja
sahāgrajaḥ sa-gopālaiḥ
suhṛdbhiś ca suhṛttama

synonyms: āgaccha—please come; yāma—let us go; gehān—to the house; naḥ—our; sa—having; nāthān—a master; kuru—please make it; adhokṣaja—O transcendental Lord; saha—with; agra-jaḥ—Your elder brother; sa-gopālaiḥ—with the cowherd men; suhṛdbhiḥ—with Your friends; ca—and; suhṛt-tama—O supreme well-wisher.
translation: Come, let us go to my house with Your elder brother, the cowherd men and Your companions. O best of friends, O transcendental Lord, in this way please grace my house with its master.
